dspace-cli.title: Document collection administration tasks for DataSpace and the OAR

comments.body:
Everything on the server has been consistently structured using BASH and tc shell scripts: 

```bash
#!/bin/bash
cd ~/ruby/cli
jr_dspace princeton_library/create_collection.rb
```

A better example would be found with:

```
#!/bin/tcsh

echo -n "firstNname: " ; set fn = $<
echo -n "lastNname: " ; set ln = $<
echo "Be aware  that users sometimes have vanity emails eg johnvanity@princeton.edu and a netid that differ"
echo -n "netid: " ; set id = $<
set email = $id"@princeton.edu"

$DSPACE_HOME/bin/dspace user --add --givenname $fn --surname $ln --email $email
echo "do not worry if you see an  error indicating a unique constraint violation"
echo "it simply means that the user you tried to create already exists in the system"
echo ""

set group =  Lib_DigPubs_Submitters
echo "making $id  member of $group"
$DSPACE_HOME/bin/dspace  dsrun edu.princeton.dspace.GroupCmd -g $group -a add,members  -n $id  | fgrep $id
```

Here is an example of a breaking script:
```
#!/bin/tcsh
echo -n "enter time stamp as YYYY-MM> ";
set stamp = $<

$DSPACE_HOME/bin/dspace bulk-list --include 'handle,dc.date.accessioned,COLLECTION.name,dc.contributor.author,pu.embargo.lift' \
 -c ITEM -r 88435/dsp01td96k251d --format TSV > Dissertations.tsv


head -5 Dissertations.tsv | tail -1 > Dissertations-$stamp.tsv
fgrep $stamp Dissertations.tsv  >> Dissertations-$stamp.tsv

echo "Report   Dissertations-$stamp.tsv has " `wc -l Dissertations-$stamp.tsv` " lines"
```
Integrating Rake for procedures such as these might be an alternative to shell scripts: https://github.com/ruby/rake
One can implement Classes for procedures using http://whatisthor.com/.
Perhaps https://github.com/pulibrary/dspace-cli/blob/master/seniorTheses/newCeollection.rb would be a good candidate for testing a different approach.
Refactoring should be delayed until basic documentation and testing is undertaken.

https://knowledge.exlibrisgroup.com/Alma/Product_Documentation/010Alma_Online_Help_(English)/090Integrations_with_External_Systems/030Resource_Management/300Webhooks

Here are the locations we are going to use for the purposes of testing:

Firestone

Location code: RARE

Reference

Location code: reference

Marquand

Reserves

marc_liberation.title: Determine how holdings with no items behave in Alma

comments.body: There is no possibility of holdings with no items in Alma. Instead, Alma auto-generates barcodes if no items exist in an incoming holding.
So, we need to develop logic for looking at the barcodes attached to items to determine if the order status needs to be presented.

https://knowledge.exlibrisgroup.com/Alma/Product_Documentation/010Alma_Online_Help_(English)/040Resource_Management/080Configuring_Resource_Management/140Configuring_the_Barcode_Generation_Method_and_Barcode_Validation
Production has been updated.

pul-the-hard-way.title: Improve the documentation for retrieving an RSA soft token for DSpace server authentication

comments.body:
Users also need to authenticate over the bastion host using the following command:

`ssh -J libvijrg@epoxy.princeton.edu libvijrg@dataspace.princeton.edu`

Where `libvijrg` is the NetID of the service account with elevated access for the servers.
Document the process of setting the RSA PIN from the online dashboard for RSA token management. This is currently found on https://sdprsa200l.princeton.edu:7004/console-selfservice/SelfService.do.
https://princeton.service-now.com/service?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=a8f092884f569e00f56c0ad14210c791 is the form needed to request a soft token.
